text: María del Pilar Bardem Muñoz (14 March 1939 – 17 July 2021) was a Spanish actress and activist. She was born in Seville, Spain. Her career began in 1965. She was known for her role as Doña Julia in Nobody Will Speak of Us When We're Dead (1995). Bardem won a Goya Award in 1995. Bardem was the mother of actors Carlos Bardem, Mónica Bardem and Javier Bardem.
